metadata.synopsis: In pre-revolutionary China, a local lord owns a fireworks factory that he leaves to his daughter, having no male heir. Chun Zhi (Ning Jing) takes control of the factory at only 19 years old, but she commands the respect of her workers, who make no issue of either her age or her gender. Unfortunately, Zhi inherited the factory under the stipulation that she never marry, a condition that becomes problematic when she falls for a traveling artist (Gang Wu).

reviews: The film is further evidence of the strength of the new Chinese cinema.
Well-told tale that registers effectively on the senses.
A visually stunning new Chinese film with a shamelessly melodramatic plot.
